New Records: The Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win its first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them
The Cavaliers are the first team to start 10-0 since the 2015-16 Warriors
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42 -- tying the eighth largest in the NBA's shot clock era
Cleveland equaled the team record for points in a half
Pre-Game Insights: Under now-Detroit coach J.B. Bickerstaff last season, the Cavaliers averaged 112.6 points per game and shot 47.9% from the field -- with the same top nine players on their roster
The only significant change made by general manager Koby Altman was hiring Atkinson after he spent three years as an assistant under Steve Kerr with the Warriors
Utilizing Cleveland's depth has also paid dividends during the best start in franchise history
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson couldn't help but smile as he looked at the box score and stared at the record of his Cleveland Cavaliers
Donovan Mitchell noted that they still haven't reached their potential and they're not going to stop working until they get there
Jarrett Allen said, 'We have a long way to go, a lot of stuff to clean up, which is great'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ten players are averaging at least 15 minutes per game, but none is logging more than 31
Cleveland has outshot its opponent in each game but has won the rebounding battle only four times
The Cavaliers also committed 20 turnovers that led to 32 points for the Warriors
